item.title: Merchant Account Credit Card Processing Made Easy
item.description: Even the smallest businesses need a way to process credit card payments. Instead of making it a difficult process, choose a reliable credit card processing company to simplify things. item.title: Fixed Wireless For Rural Retail
POS For Temporary Store Locations
item.description: A common sight during the holidays is the “pop-up shop.” These temporary stores occupy vacant spaces in malls and shopping centers, offering seasonal goods like decorations, costumes, and calendars. Once the season ends, so do their operations. Despite their temporary nature, these businesses require robust point-of-sale (POS) systems, even more so than traditional stores. The need for efficient POS systems stems from the concentrated bursts of customer traffic these stores experience.

item.title: Broadband Access Wireless Internet Providers
item.description: Wireless internet isn’t just for mobile devices. Businesses can also benefit from fixed wireless services. One affordable option utilizes existing cell towers to provide broadband similar to a T1 line at nearly half the cost. Accel Networks, for instance, partners with major carriers to leverage their bandwidth, achieving 99.9% reliability and quick installation times. This solution is ideal for businesses requiring PCI-compliant connections, like convenience stores or gas stations, especially those in areas with limited wired options.

item.title: Fixed Wireless Moving To 4G
item.description: Fixed wireless broadband for businesses has two main forms. The first, found primarily in downtown areas of major cities, uses licensed microwave services. While this method offers high bandwidth, it has a limited coverage area of a few thousand feet and requires a clear line of sight. The second approach utilizes existing 3G cellular broadband networks to provide wider coverage, comparable to a T1 line’s bandwidth, wherever there’s a cell phone signal.

item.title: Fixed Wireless Broadband Includes Canada & Puerto Rico
item.description: People often associate broadband with wired connections, like T1 lines commonly used by small to medium businesses, or the increasingly popular Ethernet option known for its speed and affordability. While satellite is vital for many chain stores, there’s another reliable broadband solution that avoids construction costs and high monthly fees: fixed wireless broadband, now available across the US, Canada, and Puerto Rico.
